returnType: The EXTRACT function returns a numeric value when the following parameters are provided: YEAR, MONTH, DAY, HOUR, MINUTE, SECOND, TIMEZONE_HOUR, TIMEZONE_MINUTE, TIMEZONE_REGION, TIMEZONE_MINUTE. The EXTRACT function returns a VARCHAR2 when TIMEZONE_REGION or TIMEZONE_ABBR parameters are provided (because the time zone name or abbreviation information is returned).
description: The Oracle/PLSQL EXTRACT function extracts a value from a date or interval value.
sample:
EXTRACT(YEAR FROM DATE '2003-08-22')
Result: 2003

EXTRACT(MONTH FROM DATE '2003-08-22')
Result: 8

EXTRACT(DAY FROM DATE '2003-08-22')
Result: 22
